templates.title: Database Documentation
templates.overview: This database serves as the backbone of a fertility-related platform, facilitating donor data management and user interactions. It comprises various tables for storing donor profiles, user information, activity logs, and more.
keypoints: Donor Profiles: Capture and store detailed donor profiles, including personal information, physical attributes, and education.
Unique IDs: Assign unique case IDs to donors for easy identification and privacy.
User Activity Logging: Record and track user activities, including registration, login, and password reset, while capturing relevant user data, IP addresses, and browser information.
Cohort Creation: Create 10 cohorts (replicas) for each donor, each with cohort-specific data, status, and pricing information.
Cohort Availability: Manage the availability and status of donor cohorts.
User Management: Store user profiles, including contact details, addresses, and login credentials. Assign roles (e.g., admin, clinic) and manage user permissions.
Favorite Donor Cohorts: Allow users to create and manage lists of favorite donor cohorts, associating them with user IDs for personalization.
Query Submission Handling: Enable users to submit queries or requests, track submission times, and manage query resolution and status.
Deleted User Records: Maintain records of deleted users, including contact details and reasons for deletion.
API User Management: Manage API users for external integration, including API keys, secrets, access permissions, and settings.
Metadata Storage: Store metadata related to users, roles, and settings, offering various configuration options.
API Logging: Log API actions, including in/out flows, associated data, success or error responses, IP addresses, and browser details.
Cohort View Count: Track the number of views for each donor cohort.
User Profile Requests: Handle user profile requests, granting special access permissions based on user requests and assignments.
Role-to-Role Relations: Establish relations between different user roles for streamlined permissions and access management.
Role Definition: Define user roles and their associated capabilities, including role status (active/inactive).
User Metadata: Store additional user metadata for enhanced user profiling.
User Settings: Manage user-specific settings and configurations.
